Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What floor is Elias-Clarke? Human Resources.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Honey, you want West 57th.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: This article was about the Take Back the Night march. This was a four-part series on the impact of busing on the public schools...

Speaker: sherry
Dialogue: I have two positions available. One is assistant to the road test editor of Auto Universe magazine.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: And the other one--?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Hi, I have an appointment with Emily Charlton--

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Okay, so... I was Miranda's second assistant, but her first assistant recently got promoted so now I'm the first...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: And you're replacing yourself.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I'm trying. Miranda sacked the last two girls after only a few weeks. We need to find someone who can survive here. Do you understand?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Yes. Of course. Who's Miranda?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: You didn't just ask me that. She's the editor in chief of Runway. Not to mention a legend. Work a year for her and you can get a job at any magazine you want. A million girls would kill for this job.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Sounds great. I'd love to be considered.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Andrea, Runway is a fashion magazine. An interest in fashion is crucial.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What makes you think I'm not interested in fashion?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Oh my God. No. No, no, no.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: She's on her way -- tell everyone!

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Her driver text-messaged. Her facialist ruptured a disk. God, these people!

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: All right, everyone. Man your battle stations!  Did somebody eat an onion bagel?

Speaker: clacker
Dialogue: Sorry, Miranda.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Oh no. You're still here. Go.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Wow, this is like self-esteem camp.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I don't understand why it's so difficult to confirm an appointment.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I'm so sorry, Miranda. I did confirm last night, but--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: The details of your incompetence do not interest me.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: And tell Richard I saw the pictures of for the feature on female paramedics and they're all so unattractive. I don't understand. How hard is it to find a decent-looking paramedic?... Also, I need to see what Nigel has called in for Gwyneth's second cover try...

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Nobody. Human resources sent her up about the assistant job and I was pre- interviewing her for you, but--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I'll do it. The last two you sent me were total disappointments. Send her in.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: She wants to see you.. Go go go....

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: My name is Andy Sachs. I recently graduated from--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: What are you doing here?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I think I could do a good job as your assistant and--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: So you don't read Runway?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: And before today, you had never heard of me?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: And you have no style or sense of fashion.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: That depends on--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: That wasn't a question.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I was Editor in Chief of the Daily Northwestern. I won a national competition for college journalists with a series on the janitor's union --

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: That's all.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: --that uncovered the exploitation of--

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: We got the exclusive on the yellow Cavalli for Gwyneth, the one he showed with a huge feathered headpiece, but she'll look like she's working the mainstage at the Golden Nugget, so instead...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Thank you for your time.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Who IS that sad little person? Are we doing a Before and After piece I don't know about?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Andrea!

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Wow. You got a job at a fashion magazine.  Was it a phone interview?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Don't be a jerk.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Miranda Priestly is famous for being unpredictable.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay, how is it that you know who she is and I didn't?

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: I'm actually a girl.

Speaker: lily
Dialogue: That would explain so much.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Seriously, Miranda is a huge deal. I bet a million girls would kill for that job.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Yeah, it's just that I'm not one of them.

Speaker: lily
Dialogue: You have to start somewhere. Look at this dump Nate works in. Paper napkins? Hello?

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: What the hell is it that you do?

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Lucky for me, I have my dream job.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: You're a corporate research analyst.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: -- which totally rocks. The free bagels on Thursday? The booze? The whores?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You should see the way the girls dress at Runway. I'm not sure I have anything to wear to work.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: You're going to be answering phones and getting coffee. You need a ballgown for that?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I think I might.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: I think you look great. Always.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You are so full of it.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Come on. Let's go home. I can think of something you can do without clothes.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Hello? Now?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Miranda decided to kill the Autumn Jacket story for September -- she's pulling up the Sedona shoot from October. You need to go into the office right this second. Pick up her coffee order on the way. Write this down.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Where are you?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'm almost there.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Yes. She gave me the job.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Clearly my opinion means nothing.  Wow. It's like Oklahoma and New Jersey had a baby out of wedlock.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Actually, I'm from Cincinnati.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: No, it's not possible. Not you.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Is there a reason my coffee is not here? Was I unclear in some way?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I hope you know this is a very difficult job for which you are totally wrong and if you mess up MY head is on the chopping block.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What if the building's on fire or my appendix explodes or something?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: One time an assistant left the desk because she sliced her hand open with a letter opener. Miranda missed Lagerfeld right before he boarded a 17 hour flight to Australia. She now works at TV Guide.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Man the desk at all times. Got it.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Miranda Priestly's office. She's not available. I'll tell her you called. Yet again.  I get to go with her to Paris for Fashion Week in the fall.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: How do I prove I'm not a psycho?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I have no idea.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Wait. What do I do if--

Speaker: jocelyn
Dialogue: Run-through at 3, shoot 8 am tomorrow. Of course. No problem.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Hi, I'm Andy, I'm the new--

Speaker: jocelyn
Dialogue: Great. Fantastic. If you'll excuse me, I gotta go pull a bunch of fringe purses out of my ass.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: That's very nice of you, but I don't need those. Miranda hired me. She knows what I look like.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Do you?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Emily!

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: She means you.  Go.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: It's too dark. I can't see any of the clothes...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: ...I think he intended to use shadow to show the contours of the...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: And what is this? I want the title of the layout to bleed over the left side of the photo...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I see, well, we needed room for the typeface to pick up the lines of the dress, which is cut on the bias, so we...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: No, no, no. That's not what I want. I made that abundantly clear...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Actually, it's Andy.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: What a fantastic story. So entertaining and full of useful information.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What kind of--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Please bore someone else with your questions. Make sure we can get Pier 59 at 8 am tomorrow... Remind Jocelyn I want to see a few of those satchels Marc is doing in the pony... And tell Simone I'll take Frankie if Maggie is not available tomorrow... And did Demarchelier confirm?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Demar--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Get him on the phone.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Do you have Demarchelier?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Demarchelier... Demarchelier...

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I have Miranda Priestly calling.  I have Patrick.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: She called me in and asked me about Pier 59. She said something about Simone and Frankie and someone else. And she needs skirts from Calvin Klein. I think that's the most important thing, but I couldn't tell. Oh, and there was something about a pony.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Did she say which skirts?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I tried to ask her, but--

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: You never ask Miranda. Anything.  All right, I'll take care of the other stuff. You go to Calvin Klein.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Me?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I'm sorry. Do you have a prior commitment? Is there some hideous pants convention?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: So I just, what, go down to the Calvin Klein store and ask them--

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: You're not going to the store.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Of course not. I'm going... to his house.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: You are catching on quickly. We always send assistants to a designer's home on their very first day. You're going to his showroom. I'll give you the address.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Sorry. Got it. What's the nearest subway stop?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Good God. You do not. Under any circumstances. Take public transportation.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: Miranda's new assistant. Congrats.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: You know--

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You're going to say a million girls would kill for my job.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: Actually, I was going to say those Jelly Beans are seven years old.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'm about to walk in. I'll call you as soon as--

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: You must be new. Congratulations. People would KILL for your job. I would. I love Miranda. She's such an icon. I've dealt with her a couple times, but I'm sure she doesn't remember.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: There's a um, variety of skirts. Let's see...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'm sorry. What's your name?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Liz.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: It's Liz.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: What did she say?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Is Ivan in by any chance?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: I'll get him.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Oh my God. What took you so long? I have to pee.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You haven't peed since I left?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: You do the coat.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: The run-through. Right.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: The editors bring in options for a shoot and Miranda chooses. She chooses every single thing in every single issue. Run-throughs are a huge deal.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Is it always like this?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: No. Sometimes it's busy.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: I thought you were kidding.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Oh, no. I was quite serious.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You eat lunch?

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Corn chowder. Interesting choice.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: None of the girls here eat anything?

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Not since 2 became the new 4 and 0

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay. You think my clothes are hideous. I get it, okay?  But I'm not going to be working in fashion forever. I don't see any reason to change everything about myself because I have this job.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: You're right. That's what this multi- million dollar industry is all about. Inner beauty.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Mr. Ravitz.

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Nigel.    Issue going well?

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Our biggest September ever.

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Great. I heard Miranda killed Autumn Jackets and pulled up the Sedona shoot. What's that costing me?

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Must have been some lousy Jackets. But I'm sure she knows what she's doing.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Always.

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Irv Ravitz.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: I'm sorry... this is Andy Sachs, Miranda's new assistant.

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Congratulations, young lady. A million girls would kill for that job.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: We should have taken the stairs.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: No... No... No... I swear I don't understand why it's so difficult for you to pull together a decent run- through. You had hours to prepare...  Where are all the advertisers?

Speaker: lucia
Dialogue: We have some pieces from Banana Republic and--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: We need more.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: You know me. A full ballerina skirt with a hint of saloon and I'm on board.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Is it too much like the--

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: --LaCroix from July? I thought of that, but with the right accessories, it could work...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Where are the belts for this skirt?

Speaker: jocelyn
Dialogue: Tough call. They're so different.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Is something funny?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: No, no, no. It's just...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: This... stuff? Okay. I understand. You think this has nothing to do with you. You go to your closet and select, say, that lumpy blue sweater because you're trying to tell the world that you take yourself too seriously to care about what's on your body. What you don't know is that your sweater is not blue. It's not even sky blue. It's cerulean. You also don't know that in 2002, De La Renta did a collection of cerulean gowns, Yves St. Laurent showed a cerulean military jacket, Dolce did skirts with cerulean beads, and in our September issue we did the definitive layout on the color. Cerulean quickly appeared in eight other major collections, then the secondary and department store lines and then trickled down to some lovely Casual Corner, where you no doubt stumbled on it.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You should have seen the look she gave me. I thought the flesh was going to melt off her face.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Gimme that. There's about eight dollars worth of Jarlsberg in there.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I just have to stick it out for one year. Then I can do what I came to New York to do. I can't let Miranda get to me. I won't.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Easy, Killer.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: And give me that sandwich.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Oh, no way. It's mine now.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Good morning, Miranda!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Get me Isaac.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: These eggs are frigid.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Pick up the Polaroids from the swimwear shoot.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: The brakes in my car are making a weird noise. Take it in.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: We need the hat from the finale of the Zac Posen show. 32. The Devil Wears Prada   2nd Blue In Progress   12/00/05

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: The girls need new boogieboards for spring break.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Pick up my shoes from Manolo.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: ...and while you're out, get Patricia.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Get me Isaac!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I have Isaac.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Dad! I'll be right down!

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: Here. Don't want you to get behind in your rent.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: How did you--  I'm gonna kill Mom. Thank you.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: Thought I'd let you at least enjoy the bread basket first.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Oh, just go ahead.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: We're just a little worried. We get emails from you at your office at 2 am, your pay is terrible, you don't get to write anything...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Hey. Not fair. I wrote those e- mails.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: I'm just trying to understand why someone who was accepted to Stanford Law turns that down to be a journalist and now you're not even doing that--

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Oh please. Not this again.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: Why did you even bother applying to law school?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Because it's what you wanted. This is what I want.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: This? Being a secretary?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'm an executive assistant.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: You hang coats, you go to Starbucks, you're a secretary, Andy.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You have to trust me. Being Miranda's assistant opens a lot of doors. Emily is going to Paris with Miranda in a few months, she'll meet editors and writers from every important magazine.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: My flight is cancelled... Some absurd weather problem.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Absolutely, Miranda. Let me see what I can do.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I need a jet from Miami to New York...  I'm trying, Miranda. No one is flying out because of the weather.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Please. It's just drizzling. Someone must be getting out. Call Donatella and get her jet. Call everyone with a jet -- Irv, Armani...

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: Andy, come on. Let's go in.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I've done everything I could think of. I don't know what else to do.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Emily. Stop making excuses. GET ME HOME.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Oh my God. She is going to murder me.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: Would it help if I talked to her?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: The girls' recital was wonderful. They played Rachmaninoff and everyone loved it. Except for me... because I was not there.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'm so sorry, Miranda.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Do you know why I hired you?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I did everything I could think of--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: That's all.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Excuse me, where do you think you--

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: She hates me, Nigel.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: And that's my problem because -- wait, no. Not my problem.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I need your help. I don't know what to do. It's like I'm completely beneath her contempt.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: So quit.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: That's not fair. I'm lucky to be working for Miranda -- I didn't get that at first, but I do now. I want to be here. But it just seems like no matter how hard I try, I don't do anything right.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Andy, please. Be serious. You're not trying. You're whining.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay, fine!

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Oh, no. No way...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You do it with the other girls.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: The other girls are different. They really want it.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Please, Nigel. Don't make me beg...

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: I don't know what you expect me to do.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: A... poncho?

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: You'll take what I give you and you'll like it.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I have no idea why Miranda hired her.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: Me, neither. The other day we were in the Beauty Department and she held up the Shu Uemura eyelash curler and said "What is this?"

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I knew from the moment I saw her that she was a complete and utter--

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Miranda Priestly's office. She's not in. I'll leave word.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What do you think?

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: I think we better get out of here before my girlfriend sees me with you.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Wanna lift, stranger?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: The gowns are fabulous, Ralph. We're using the burgundy for the cover try and the lemon chiffon for the goddess story.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Bang & Olufsen. Charlie Rose sent it to Miranda for her birthday.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: All for a woman who doesn't need anything. Perfect.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Here... A bunch of Kiehl's, some Mason Pearson hair brushes...

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Dammit, I love your job.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: It's called "Pink". For women.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Men can be pink. I have a pink side.

Speaker: lily
Dialogue: Please. We're eating.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Sure you can.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Why do women need so many bags? You get one, it holds all your junk, aren't you done?

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Fashion is not about utility, Nate. An accessory is merely a piece of iconography used to express individual identity.

Speaker: lily
Dialogue: And it's preeeetty.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: That too.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Thing is, it turns out there's a lot more to Runway than fancy purses... you know who's coming into the office Friday? John Updike.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Why, does he need a sweater?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Look, there's a piece by Jay McInerney, an essay by Joan Didion, an interview with Christiane Amanpour oh...

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Look who's drinking the KoolAid.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Give me the phone.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Oh, look. The Dragon Lady. Of course.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Give me the phone.

Speaker: lily
Dialogue: I'll talk to her. Tell her she needs to get her own scrambled eggs.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Come on, guys. Give me the phone!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'm looking for James Holt...

Speaker: james
Dialogue: You must be the new Emily. Let me see.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You.

Speaker: james
Dialogue: Duh.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'll guard it with my life.

Speaker: james
Dialogue: Come on. You work for Miranda, you must be in desperate need of hard liquor.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: He's right. I had the punch at James's last party, woke up in Hoboken wearing nothing but boxers and a cowboy hat.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Hi. I, um... I have to go.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: But you want to stay. You've never been to a party like this.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: God, I love it when total strangers tell me how I feel.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: That's my way.  Christian Thompson.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Christian Thompson? You're kidding. You write for every magazine I love. I actually reviewed your collection of essays for my college paper.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Did you mention my good looks and killer charm?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: No, but I did point out some factual errors and a penchant for confessional semi-fiction that borders on self-indulgent.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: You and the Times.  And what do you do?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Well, I want to work somewhere like the New Yorker or Vanity Fair. I'm also a writer, but--

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Is that right? I should read your stuff. Send it over.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Thank you. That would be great. Anyway, for now I'm Miranda Priestly's assistant.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: You're kidding. Oh, that's too bad. You'll never survive Miranda.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: You're smart, you're nice, you have a point of view. You can't do that job.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I have to go.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Let me guess. You have a boyfriend waiting. From... not high school... college? Nice-looking guy, devoted, about to ask you to move in with him, but you're not sure...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You. Are not a nice person.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Nice to meet you, Miranda girl.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: For your information, he's really handsome. And we already live together!

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: You got the nuclear briefcase from the undisclosed location. I'm proud of you.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Doug and some of his banker buddies are playing Texas Hold `Em at his apartment. Gonna go get me some of that Wall Street cash.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: But I came back so we could hang out.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Man, I'm sorry. You didn't make that crystal clear when you stormed off after calling me an asshole.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay, look, I'm sorry about that--

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: I'll see you later, okay?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Emily!

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: They're not expecting us until Tuesday. Did she say why?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Yes, she explained every detail of her decision-making, then we brushed each other's hair and gabbed about American Idol.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: I see your point.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Just let us out here.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: And then there's the pursing of the lips.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What does that mean?

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Catastrophe.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Last time I was here, James was having this cool party and--  --and this is why you don't like people riding up in the elevator with you.

Speaker: james
Dialogue: Miranda. Great to see you.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Yes. I did.

Speaker: james
Dialogue: This season I started to think about the intersection of East and West...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: She pursed her lips and because of that he's going to change his entire collection?

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: You still don't get it, do you? Her opinion is the only one that matters.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Make sure you confirm my dinner with--

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: --Galliano at Pastis. Done.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: And I need to see the look book for the November denim shoot.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: It's in the car.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Fine.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Guard this with your life.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Of course. If I can deliver the Book, that means I must have done something right, that she doesn't think I'm psycho. Oh, and she actually called me Andrea instead of Emily. Isn't that great?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Yeah. Whoopee. Okay, now, it's very important that you do EXACTLY what I'm about to tell you.

Speaker: intercom
Dialogue: Book's ready!

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Do not talk to anyone. Do not look at anyone. That is of the utmost importance. You must be invisible. Do you understand?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: cassidy
Dialogue: It's that door. On the left.

Speaker: caroline
Dialogue: You can give us the Book.

Speaker: cassidy
Dialogue: We'll give it to her.

Speaker: caroline
Dialogue: It's okay. Come on up.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: But I can't... Shh...

Speaker: cassidy
Dialogue: It's okay.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: What did you want me to do? Walk out in the middle of a photo shoot?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: I rushed out of an investment committee meeting early, then I sat there waiting for you for almost an hour...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: We were in a loft near the Seaport. My phone didn't work. I told you.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: ...and I knew what everyone in the restaurant was thinking. There he is, waiting for HER again--

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay, before you start freaking out, it wasn't such a big deal. The twins said hello, I said hello back, then I went upstairs and gave the book to Miranda--

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: You went upstairs? Oh my God. Why didn't you just climb into bed with her and ask for a bedtime story?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You're right. I made a mistake.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Don't you understand? If you get fired, that might jeopardize Paris for me. And if that happens, I will search every Blimpie's in the tri-state area until I find you and kill you.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Wait a second. She's going to fire me?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I don't know. She's not happy.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: An-dre-a.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Miranda, about last night, I--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I need the new Harry Potter book for the twins.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Of course. I'll run down to Barnes & Noble right now.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Did you fall down and smack your little head on the pavement?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Not that I can recall.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: We have all the published Harry Potter books. The girls want to know what happens next.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: So you want the... unpublished manuscript.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: We know everyone in publishing. Shouldn't be a problem.  You can do anything, right?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: She doesn't get it. There's no way I can get that book. I don't care who I call.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: My girls are leaving on the train to their Grandmother's at 3. They'll need the book by then.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I'd like my steak in fifteen minutes.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: No problem.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Oh look, you're getting paranoid. Yay. It's not just me. Listen, don't freak out. There could be a silver lining here.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Or--

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Or, you know, that thing you were saying about the cat.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: It's for Miranda Priestly... it's very important. Yes, I know, it's impossible to get...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Anything? Can you try again? I would really appreciate any leads at all... thanks. No pressure. If I don't have it by 3, I'm fired.

Speaker: marty
Dialogue: What an amazing job, working for someone like Ms. Priestly.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Yeah. It's a real party.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Of course I remember you, Miranda Girl. You shaken off the college boyfriend yet?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Listen. I desperately need a favor. And I don't know many people in the book world...

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: The Harry Potter manuscript? You've gotta be kidding.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Just tell her it can't be done. You'll have to come up with a plan B.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: We're talking about Miranda Priestly. There is no plan B, only plan A. 62. The Devil Wears Prada   2nd Blue In Progress   12/00/05

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Is she back? Am I fired?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: You know, I rarely say this to people who aren't me, but you need to calm down.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: What is that doing here? I ordered it ages ago.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Can you make it extra hot? Like, center of the sun hot?

Speaker: barrista
Dialogue: Sounds like a great job.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Actually, it is. A million girls would kill for it.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Want a mocha?

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Quit? Are you sure?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I failed. She's going to fire me anyway. Might as well beat her to the punch.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Wow. Good for you. Congratulations, Andy. You're free.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Call you later.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You didn't.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Oh yes. A friend of a friend does the cover art. She has the manuscript.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: No. That would mean I actually... did something right.  But see... thing is... See, I was about to...

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: You want this, you better hurry. Meet me at the St. Regis.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Yes, I'm meeting someone...

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: You have one hour.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'm begging you. You have to stall her. Just ten minutes.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Too much traffic on 5th. UN's in session.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: One copy? What are my twins supposed to do with that... share?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Actually I made two copies. And had them color-copied, re-set and bound so they wouldn't look like manuscripts.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: And where exactly are those fabulous copies? I don't see them anywhere.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Anything else I can do for you?

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: I went over to Dean & DeLuca -- man, they charge like five bucks a strawberry, but I figured, you quit, we should celebrate.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Listen, Nate--

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: So you quit, but you're still doing the twins' science project. Big of you.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: After I called you, I realized... It doesn't make sense to throw away all these months of hard work. I just had a moment of weakness. That's all.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Either that or your job sucks and your boss is a wacko.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: That's all it is, Nate. Just a job.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: No, no. It's an important magazine. That's what you said, right?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I get the point, Nate.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: The new Botox. The new pea coat. The new  Gstaad. What the hell is--

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Gstaad. It's a ski resort. In Switzerland.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: See? I now live with someone who knows that. Thank you, Miranda Priestly.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Nate, it's not like I run the magazine. I just work there, remember?

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: That's the thing -- I liked your old clothes.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What about these? These are pretty nice.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: I like that.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: ...Posen's doing some very sculptural suits, so Testino wants to shoot them at the Noguchi Garden in the Chase building.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Perfect. What about the accessories pages for April?

Speaker: jocelyn
Dialogue: One thought was enamel -- bangles, pendants, earrings--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: We did that two years ago. What else?

Speaker: jocelyn
Dialogue: Well, they're showing a lot of florals for spring and so--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Florals. For spring. Groundbreaking.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: But we thought about shooting them in an industrial space.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: --which--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Are you okay?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Tonight's the benefit. I've been looking forward to it for MONTHS. I refuse to be sick. I'm wearing Valentino.  Everyone's going to be leaving to get dressed soon, so after you drop off Miranda's Fendi bag at the re-beaders, you can just go home.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Great. Thanks. That's perfect, because I need to get to Magnolia Bakery before they close...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I want to make sure before the benefit that you are both fully prepped on the guest list.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Um... I thought only the first assistant went to the benefit.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Only when the first assistant hasn't decided to be disgustingly ill. You'll come and help Emily.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I don't see why she needs both of us.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Don't look at me. This is the last thing I want to do.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: These are all the guests. Miranda invites everyone. We have to make sure they all think she knows exactly who they are. I've been studying for weeks.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I need to learn all these people by tonight?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Don't be silly.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Lily, just start without me. I'll be there as soon as I can.

Speaker: lily
Dialogue: Okay, but hurry.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I will. I promise. Believe me, this is the last thing I want to--

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Of course. A few extra yards of fabric and a staple gun and we're in business.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Remember, there are two keys to wearing an evening gown -- one is to maintain a regal bearing. The second--

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: ...this benefit is the social event of the season. It represents what Runway is about -- grace, style, elegance...

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Oh my God, Andy. You look... chic.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: And you look... so thin.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Do I? It's for Paris. I'm on a new diet. I don't eat anything, and then, when I feel like I'm about to faint, I eat a cube of cheese.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: It's definitely working.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I know. I'm just one stomach flu away from my goal weight.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: That's... great.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Ready?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: We need to make sure we're there the second she walks in.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I was wondering how long you think we'll have to stay because I was hoping to--

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: There she is.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: John. Good to see you.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: That's Massimo Cortileono, chairman of-

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: She knows him.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Massimo, you made it. I was worried you'd be too busy with your new factory in Ortezzano--

Speaker: massimo
Dialogue: I would never miss a chance to see you, Miranda, darling.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Emily?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: That's... Wait... I know who that is... It's...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Ambassador Franklin. And that's the woman he left his wife for, Rebecca. The woman he's leaving HER for is the man walking down the stairs in Valentino.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Ambassador, Rebecca.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: That's... Jacqueline Follet, right? From French Runway.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Yes. Oh my God. Miranda hates her. She was supposed to arrive after Miranda left...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Ah, Bonsoir, Cherie. Ta robe est rudement chouette.

Speaker: jacqueline
Dialogue: I like your dress too. Very... Americaine. Sportif.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Thank you for coming to our little get together tonight.

Speaker: jacqueline
Dialogue: Of course. I plan my whole year around it.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: And we're all so grateful.

Speaker: jacqueline
Dialogue: After all, we're family, no?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Alors, Jacqueline, ditez-moi, avez- vous rencontr Brad Pitt?

Speaker: jacqueline
Dialogue: Ah, no... Pas encore...

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: You can go. I've got it from here.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Are you sure?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Go. Have fun.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Thank you. Thank you so much.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Darling, there you are.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: It's a banner evening. Three people have failed to recognize me, one person called me Mr. Priestly, and now the damned bartender refuses to serve me.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'm sorry to bother you, but I've been dying to ask you... Is it true that John Cheever used to ghostwrite the editor's page of Manhattan Magazine in the 50's?...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Come on, darling, let's get something to eat. I'm starved, aren't you?

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Look at you... you're a vision. Thank God I saved your job.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Hey, I figured out a few things on my own, too. Turns out I'm not as nice as you thought.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: God I hope not.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Do you really say things like that to people?

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Evidently.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I have to go...

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Are you sure? My editor from Vanity Fair is in there and I was going to introduce you to him.  You sent me your stuff, remember? I have to be honest, I only read a couple -- that was quite a big packet - - but they weren't half-bad. You're pretty talented, Andy. He should meet you. Come on in. Just one drink.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Well, maybe I could--  No no no. I can't. I just can't.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Say hello to the boyfriend for me.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Can you go any faster?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Happy Birthday.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Don't worry about it. I'm going to bed.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Can we at least talk about it this--

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: You look really pretty.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I don't understand what's so difficult about scheduling a preview. If you want Miranda to give you any editorial, we'll need to see the clothing at least three weeks before the show. Yes, please. See what you can do.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Everything okay?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Yeah. I'm... fine.

Speaker: jocelyn
Dialogue: No, no, no. I think Gisele should be the lizard and Vivian the donkey.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: The lizard's better with the Dolce.  Sometimes I can't believe I talk about this crap all day.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Get these to Miranda right away. Tell her I switched in the Dior for the Rochas.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Great. No problem.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Hey. Adjust the attitude. Don't make me feed you to one of the models.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Sorry. Busy day. And my personal life is going down the drain. That's all.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Join the club. You start to do well at work, that's what happens.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Andrea. Come up here.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Paris is the most important week of my year. I need the best team possible with me.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Wait. You want ME to -- oh, no. No, no. Emily would die. Her whole life is about Paris.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: If you don't go, I'll assume you're not serious about your future at Runway or any other publication.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: But--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: That's all.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Don't forget to tell Emily.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Sorry I'm late. Miranda wanted some scarves from Hermes and she told me yesterday but I forgot and so--

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I freaked out of course, but then I just called Martine at home and she opened the store early, so I got them.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay. Emily. When you get in, I want to talk to you about something--

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I hope it's not another Miranda problem--

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Not exactly.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Good. Because I've got so much to deal with before I go, I swear to God I can't even--

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I don't care if she was going to fire you or beat you with a red hot poker, you should have said no.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I didn't have a choice. You know how she is.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Oh, please. That's a pathetic excuse.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Look, I know you're mad. And I don't blame you.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Face it, Andy. You sold your soul the day you put on your first pair of Jimmy Choos.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Emily--

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I said, go!

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: You're going to Paris for the couture shows? That's the coolest fashion event of the year -- who are you going to see Galliano? Lagerfeld? Nicolas Ghesquiere?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay, now you're scaring me.

Speaker: lily
Dialogue: I wasn't sure you would be able to make it.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What are you talking about? I wouldn't miss this.

Speaker: lily
Dialogue: I'm just glad you're here. Start with the murals in the other room. They're amazing...

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Hey, Miranda Girl.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Come on.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: It's true. I'm profiling Gaultier for Interview and I was making plans for Paris and found myself wondering if you would be there.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Actually...

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: That's great. I'm staying at a fantastic little hotel in the Seventh across the street from a falafel restaurant that will change your life.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Sorry. I'll be too busy working. You'll have to find someone else's life to change.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: But that's just it. I'm starting to wonder if I can.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: He's just a guy I know from work.

Speaker: lily
Dialogue: Yeah. That looked like work.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You're making a big a deal out of--

Speaker: lily
Dialogue: The Andy I know is madly in love with Nate, is always five minutes early and thinks Club Monaco is couture. For the last 16 years I've known everything about that Andy, but this person?

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: You're going to Paris?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: It just happened--

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: I thought Paris was some big deal for Emily and--

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Great. Now you're going to give me a hard time, too?

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: What the hell is wrong with you?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Miranda asked me and I couldn't say no, okay? I didn't have a choice.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: I know, I know. That's your answer for everything lately. I didn't have a choice. Like this job was forced on you. Like you don't make these decisions yourself...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay. I get it, you're mad because I work late all the time, because I missed your birthday party--

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Oh, come on. What am I, four?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You hate Runway. And Miranda. You think fashion is stupid. You've made that clear.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Andy, I make port wine reductions all day. I'm not exactly in the Peace Corps. I wouldn't care if you were out all night pole dancing if you did it with some integrity.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: So now I have no integrity. Great.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: You used to say this was just a job. You made fun of the Runway girls. And now you've become one of them.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: That's absurd.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Look at you. Now that I know how much you're willing to change to be successful, it makes me wonder if we ever had anything in common.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You don't mean that.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: I do. I really do.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Then maybe this trip is coming at a good time. Maybe we should take a break.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: In case you're wondering, the person whose calls you always take, that's the relationship you're in.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Hello, Miranda...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Wait. This is not right. Miranda is staying in the suite.

Speaker: bellman
Dialogue: That's correct, Mademoiselle. Miranda Priestly's suite is down the hall.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: This is my room?

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: You know, I've been thinking, and you still owe me for Harry Potter.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Oh, do I?

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Of course you do. You working tonight?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Actually, Miranda has a dinner.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: So you're free. Perfect. Oh, but there's a problem, huh? Le Boyfriend.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Oh, you're so full of it. You are not desol at all.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Yeah, not even a little. What time should I pick you up?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: There you are. We need to go over the seating chart for the luncheon.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Sure. No problem. I have it right here, um...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: By all means, move at a glacial pace. You know how that thrills me.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: But your table is full.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Stephen won't be coming.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: So Stephen is not... so you don't need me to fetch Stephen from the airport tomorrow?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Well, if you speak to him and he decides to rethink the divorce, then "fetch" him. Fetch away.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Another divorce in the papers... and we all know what they'll say about me - - Dragon Lady, career-obsessed, drove away another "Mr. Priestly".

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Miranda, I'm so sorry. If you want me to cancel your evening, I can.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Don't be ridiculous... why would you do that?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Miranda, is there... is there anything else I can do?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Your job.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Go.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Hi. Listen, I need Miranda's itinerary because--

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: That outfit.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Oh, I just threw it on.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Incredible. Well, I guess my work here really is done. Come on. Let's have champagne. We're celebrating.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What are we toasting?

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: To getting the dream job, the one a million girls wanted.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Nigel. I got my job months ago.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: I'm not talking about you.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You're leaving? Nigel, I can't imagine Runway without you.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Can you believe it? For the first time in eighteen years, I'm going to call the shots in my own life. One day I might be able to come to Paris and actually... see Paris.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: God. I'm so happy for you, Nigel. You deserve it.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Bet your ass.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: ...I've never seen anyone as dedicated as Miranda.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: That's fantastic. Can we stop talking about her now?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'm just saying, yes, there are things she does I don't agree with, but...

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Oh, come on, Andy. You hate her. Just admit it. She's a notorious sadist, and not in the good way.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay, so she's tough, but if Miranda were a man, no one would notice anything but how great she is at her job.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: I can't believe this. You're defending her. The wide-eyed girl peddling her earnest newspaper stories -- you're crossing over to the dark side.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I resent that.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: You shouldn't. It's sexy.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Sexy? Really?

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Really.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I have no idea where we're going. You could be leading me anywhere...

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Don't worry. I know this city like the back of my hand. It's my favorite place on the planet. You know what Gertrude Stein said -- "America is my country and Paris is my hometown."

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You are unbelievable. Do you write that stuff down and file it away to use on girls?

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: I work free-lance. Leaves me with some time on my hands.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Well, I never understood why everyone was so crazy about Paris, but now...

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Thank God.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What the hell is this?

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: What does it look like? It's a mock- up.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Of?

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Of what American Runway will look like when Jacqueline is the new editor-in- chief.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: They're replacing Miranda?

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: Yes. And she's bringing me in to run all the editorial content.  Are you really surprised? Jacqueline is a lot younger than Miranda. Has a fresher take on things. Not to mention that American Runway is one of the most expensive books in the business. Jacqueline does the same thing with a lot less money. Irv is a businessman, you know.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Miranda will be devastated. Runway is her whole life. He can't do that to her.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: It's done. Irv's going to tell Miranda after the party for James.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: And she has no idea...?

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: She's a big girl. She'll be fine.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I have to go.

Speaker: christian
Dialogue: It's done, Andy.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Oh, thank God. Where are you?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I need to talk to you. Right away. It's about Jacqueline Follet, she--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Excuse us a moment.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I have to talk to you.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Do not disturb me again.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Miranda, wait. I have to talk to you. You can fire me if you want to after that, but...  Irv is going to make Jacqueline Follet editor-in-chief of Runway. Christian Thompson told me, he's going to work for her. Irv's going to tell you today. I thought if I told you now, you could fix it.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Are those freesias?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What? No. I specifically told them--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: If I see freesia anywhere, I will be very disappointed.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: For seventy-two years, Runway has been more than a magazine, it's been a beacon of elegance and grace. Miranda Priestly is the finest possible guardian of that beacon, setting a standard that inspires people across the globe. Ladies and gentlemen, I give you Miranda Priestly.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Thank you everyone. Before I talk to you about James and everything he's accomplished, I have news.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You said it was your dream job.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: I've given her everything I have, Andy. She knows that.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: But you don't need her. You could just leave anyway and-

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: When the time is right, she'll pay me back.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You sure about that?

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: No. But I hope for the best. I have to.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I'm ready to go.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: You thought I didn't know.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Then I let Irv know Jacqueline was unavailable.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Any of his other choices would find the job impossible and the magazine would surely suffer. Especially because of the list--

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: ...all of whom have promised to follow me whenever and if ever I leave Runway. To any publication I choose. Of course, as soon as Irv understood, he reconsidered.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I must say, I was impressed with you, how intently you tried to warn me.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: But I don't think I am like that.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Of course you can. You already did. To Emily.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: That's not what I -- that was different. I didn't have a choice.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: No. You did choose. You chose to get ahead. You want this life, those choices are necessary.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: But what if it's not what I want? I mean, what if I don't want to live the way you do?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Don't be silly, Andrea. This is what everyone wants. Everyone wants to be us.

Speaker: lily
Dialogue: Sorry. Town car's in the shop.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You're such a pain.

Speaker: lily
Dialogue: And you'd be lost without me.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: True.

Speaker: lily
Dialogue: Does this mean I have to give my purse back?

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: I have to be at work in ten minutes. What's up?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I just wanted to say...

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: Shoes. And jackets and belts and--

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Nate, I'm just... I'm so sorry.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: I flew up to Boston while you were gone. Interviewed at the Oak Room.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: And?

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: You're looking at their new sous-chef. I'm moving up there in a few weeks.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: That's great, I... congratulations.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: They have bread in Boston. Might even have Jarlsberg. We might be able to figure something out.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You think?

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: You never know.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Not sure.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: I'm not worried about you. Anything you try, you're gonna kick ass.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You think so?

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: No. I know it.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Thanks. I actually have a job interview today.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: And that's what you're wearing? 106A. The Devil Wears Prada   2nd Blue In Progress   12/00/05

Speaker: editor
Dialogue: You know our pay is crap.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: That's fine.

Speaker: editor
Dialogue: Your clips were excellent. That thing on the janitor's union... that's exactly what we do here.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Learned a lot. In the end, though, I kind of screwed it up.

Speaker: editor
Dialogue: That's not what I hear.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: My God, you call this a letter? Can you spell any word in the English language?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Emily, it's Andy. Don't hang up. I have a favor to ask you.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: You're joking. YOU have a favor to ask of ME?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Thing is, I have all these clothes from Paris and I don't have anyplace to wear them, so I was wondering... is there any way you could take them off my hands?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Well, I don't know. It is a huge imposition, but I suppose I could help you out... I'll have Roy pick them up this afternoon.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Thanks, Emily. I appreciate it.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Why can't you be more like Andy?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: ...I don't understand why it's so challenging to get a car when I ask for one.
